eplimited.osea.classification

Class BeatDetectionAndClassification

  • java.lang.Object
    • eplimited.osea.classification.BeatDetectionAndClassification

  • public class BeatDetectionAndClassification
extends java.lang.Object
    BDAC contains functions for handling Beat Detection And Classification. The primary function calls a qrs detector. When a beat is detected it waits until a sufficient number of samples from the beat have occurred. When the beat is ready, BeatDetectAndClassify passes the beat and the timing information on to the functions that actually classify the beat.

      • BeatDetectAndClassify

        public BeatDetectionAndClassification.BeatDetectAndClassifyResult BeatDetectAndClassify(int ecgSample)
        BeatDetectAndClassify() implements a beat detector and classifier. ECG samples are passed into BeatDetectAndClassify() one sample at a time. BeatDetectAndClassify has been designed for a sample rate of 200 Hz. When a beat has been detected and classified the detection delay is returned and the beat classification is returned. For use in debugging, the number of the template that the beat was matched to is returned in via beatMatch.
        Parameters:
        ecgSample -
        Returns:
        BeatDetectAndClassify() returns 0 if no new beat has been detected and classified. If a beat has been classified, BeatDetectAndClassify returns the number of samples since the approximate location of the R-wave.
